4 wounded''Bulletins'' 1859, pp. 99â€“100 |casualties2 = Unknown |notes = 1 Comprising 2 [[Launch (boat)|launchers]], 2 [[barge]]s, 3 [[Pinnace (ship's boat)|pinnaces]], 6 [[Cutter (boat)|cutters]], and 1 [[Captain's gig|gig]] }} {{Campaignbox Second Opium War}} The '''Capture of the French Folly Fort''' by British forces in China occurred on 6 November 1856 during the [[Second Opium War]]. The British dispersed 23 Chinese war [[Junk (ship)|junks]] and captured the French Folly Fort in the [[Pearl River (China)|Pearl River]] near the city of [[Guangzhou|Canton]] (Guangzhou) in the [[Guangdong]] province. The battle lasted nearly an hour. The British consul [[Harry Smith Parkes|Harry Parkes]] described the Chinese as putting up "a very hot resistance" and the engagement as "exceeding creditable to the bravery not only of our men, but of the Chinese also." == Gallery == File:Plan of Action of 6 Nov 1856.jpg|Map of the battle File:Capture of French Folly Fort - Termination.jpg|End of the action, showing the explosion of the junks File:Barracouta & Calcutta's pinnace engaging junks.jpg|''Barracouta'' and a pinnace from the ''[[HMS Calcutta (1831)|Calcutta]]'' engaging junks File:A battle at French Folly Fort.jpg|''A battle at French Folly Fort'' by a Chinese painter == Notes == {{reflist}} == References == *''[https://books.google.com/books?id=ZMQsAAAAMAAJ Bulletins and Other State Intelligence for the Year 1857]''.
